remarks:
A syllogism rule of inference.  The second premise is used to replace the consequent of the first premise.  (Contributed by NM, 5-Jan-1993.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 30-Jul-2012.) 

---

 A syllogism rule of inference.  The second premise is used to replace the consequent of the first premise.  (Contributed by NM, 5-Aug-1993.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 30-Jul-2012.)
statement:
syl6.1 $e |- ( ph -> ( ps -> ch ) ) $.
syl6.2 $e |- ( ch -> th ) $.
syl6 $p |- ( ph -> ( ps -> th ) ) $.
